item.title: Leslie Burns
item.description: Had a Scottish friend/client email me this morning with "Blink twice if your country needs help" and a pic of the GOP ear bandages. Replied "I'm blinking like a disco strobe."

item.title: Molly White
item.description: Coinbase has tried to portray its ‚ÄúStand With Crypto‚Äù PAC as having broad grassroots support among over a million ‚Äúcrypto advocates‚Äù, and boasts on its homepage of nearly $180 million raised by these advocates.Its first quarterly FEC filing reveals it has had only $13,690 in contributions from seven people since its creation. Two of them work for Stand With Crypto and two of them work for Coinbase.#crypto #CryptoLobby #USpolitics

item.title: Lennart Poettering
item.description: So, if you ask me what my takeaway from the Crowdstrike issue is, I'd say: boot counting/boot assessment/automatic fallback should really be a MUST for today's systems. *Before* you invoke your first kernel you need have tracking of boot attempts and a logic for falling back to older versions automatically. It's a major shortcoming that this is not default behaviour of today's distros, in particular commercial ones.Of course systemd has supported this for a long time:https://systemd.io/AUTOMATIC_BOOT_ASSESSMENT/

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Justice delayed is justice denied? An(other) example of the utility of PubPeer's early-warning role.Published in 2011, questioned in 2013, "corrected" in 2016, retracted in 2024. The retraction like the correction studiously avoids asking the question: "how did that happen?" See the rotations in comment #5.If a paper can be evaluated for publication in two weeks, then maybe it should be possible to reconsider its publication in fewer than 11 years?https://pubpeer.com/publications/0EE74C4141AE8E5B960856232E8F8E#5

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: "And Thiel‚Äôs track record in winning, in successfully betting on the longest of odds, on biding his time, is maybe the most chilling of all the factors in a fortnight that has started to feel like the start of a run on the bank."https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/article/2024/jul/20/tech-broligarchs-court-trump-vance-elon-musk-peter-thiel

item.title: Kim Scheinberg
item.description: A friend just texted asking who the most influential person in the Dem party currently is. I said I had no idea, but I'd bet the most consequential right now is Marc Elias @marcelias And I'm relieved to learn that he said this an hour ago:"Before the media gets rolling, let me be clear: The Democratic nominee for president will be on all 50 state ballots. There is no basis for any legal challenge. Period."

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Just bizarre. It seems that there are quite a number of papers that contain MD5 hashes in their text. And, at least in some cases, those MD5 hashes are hashes of the words they replace.https://pubpeer.com/search?q=md5

item.title: Debora Weber-Wulff
item.description:
@BorisBarbour @JorgeStolfi
Some LLMs offer permalinks to a discussion. These look like MD5 hashes (I have not checked!) so maybe they got copied inadvertantly.

item.title: Mastodon Migration
item.description: Just got off the line with both millennial daughters who last week were completely checked out on politics even considering the stakes of this election. Both gave hundreds to Kamala Harris yesterday, and are looking for ways to get involved in the campaign. They were energized and in tears with hope for the future. What had seemed to them like an inevitable descent into a dystopian fascism is now a fight for a better more democratic future. The change in attitude is impossible to overstate.

item.description: Finnish Foreign Minister Valtonen suggested that Hungary should consider whether EU membership aligns with its values, given the differences in principles. She emphasized that the Hungarian government should not give the impression of representing the EU. https://www.sss.fi/2024/07/valtonen-unkarista-jossain-vaiheessa-on-hyva-kysya-onko-eu-oikea-viiteryhma/

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2024/07/collapse-of-scientific-standards-at.html
In which I manage to criticise editor, publisher, researchers and science journalists - there's really a growing problem whereby anything can get published without any quality control, and it is making a mockery of the idea that we can trust the peer-reviewed literature.
